recipe_long_name: Sev Tameta Nu Shaak (green Tomatoes) recipe - How to make Sev Tameta Nu Shaak (green Tomatoes)
recipe_ing:
250 gms green tomatoes
 100 gms nylon sev
 2 to 4 cloves of garlic (lehsun) (optional)
 2 cups  water
 2 tsp oil
 1 tsp cumin seeds (jeera)
 1/4 tsp turmeric powder (haldi)
 1 tsp chilli powder
 2 tsp coriander (dhania) powder
 a pinch of asafoetida (hing)
 1 to 2 tbsp jaggery (gur)
 salt to taste
 few springs of coriander (dhania) leaves for garnishing
recipe:
Chop the tomatoes into small cubes. chop the garlic very finely.
Heat the oil in a frying pan. add the cumin seeds and aloow them to splutter. add the asafoetida and the chilli powder and immediately add the chopped tomatoes, garlic and water.
Cook on a medium flame till the tomatoes are done. add a little more water if required.
Add the jaggery, salt and dhania powder. cover and cook till the jaggery melts completely.
Do not let all the water to evaporate. maintain a watery gravy to soften the sev.
At the time of serving, fill half of the serving bowl with the vegetable and top it with the nylon sev. garnish with chopped coriander leaves.
Serve hot with rotis, parathas, steamed rice or khichdi.
tags:
Gujarati Shaak Sabzi
Jain Subzi / Gravies
times: Preparation Time: 5 mins, Cooking Time: 15 mins., Total Time: 20 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Bajari Khichhu recipe - How to make Bajari Khichhu
recipe_ing:
3/4 cup rice flour (chawal ka atta)
 1/4 cup bajra (black millet) flour
 1 tsp green chilli paste
 1 tsp papad khar
 4 tsp oil
 salt to taste
 1/2 tsp cumin seeds (jeera) powder
recipe:
Method
Combine 2 cups of water, oil, salt, chilli paste and papadkhar in a non-stick pan and cook till the mixture comes to boil.
Add the flours and cumin seeds and mix well, while stirring continuously, making sure that no lumps are formed.
Remove from the flame and cover for 2 minutes.
Serve hot garnished with a few coriander leaves and chilly oil.
tags: Gujarati Farsans
times: Preparation Time: 15 mins, Cooking Time: 15 mins, Total Time: 30 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Karele ki Karari Kachri recipe - How to make Karele ki Karari Kachri
recipe_ing:
3 medium bitter gourd (karela)
 1 tsp cornflour
 1 tsp coriander (dhania) powder
 1 tsp chilli powder
 1/2 tsp dried mango powder (amchur)
 salt to taste
 1/2 tsp chaat masala
 oil for deep-frying
recipe:
Method
Wash and cut the karela into thin rounds.
Add little salt, mix well and keep aside for 30 minutes.
Squeeze out all water from the karela and add the cornflour, coriander powder, chilli powder, amchoor powder and little salt, toss well and keep aside to marinate for at least one hour.
Heat the oil in a kadhai and deep fry the kachris till they turn golden brown and crisp from all the sides.
Drain on an absorbent paper.
Serve hot.
tags:
Gujarati Shaak Sabzi
Sukhi Sabzis
times: Preparation Time: 10 mins, Cooking Time: 10  mins, Total Time: 20 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Theplaas recipe - How to make Theplaas
recipe_ing:
1 cup  leftover chilka moong dal khichdi
 1 cup whole wheat flour (gehun ka atta)
 salt to taste
 2 tsp chilli powder
 2 tsp coriander (dhania) powder
 1/4 tsp turmeric powder (haldi)
 2 tsp curds (dahi) (optional)
recipe:
Prepare a soft dough using all the ingredients.
Divide into 8 rolls.
With a soft hand roll out the theplas one by one.
Fry theplas with a little oil on medium flame.
tags:
Gujarati Roti, Thepla recipe collection
Breakfast using Leftovers
Breakfast Theplas, Parathas
Indian Tawa
Tava
Quick Rotis / Parathas
times: Preparation Time: 10 mins, Cooking Time: 15mins, Total Time: 25 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Baingan Bhaat recipe - How to make Baingan Bhaat
recipe_ing:
1 1/2 cups horizontally sliced brinjals (baingan / eggplant)
 1 cup long grained rice (basmati)
 1/2 tsp mustard seeds ( rai / sarson)
 1/2 tsp cumin seeds (jeera)
 3 cardamoms (elaichi)
 1/2  " piece of cinnamon (dalchini)
 5 cloves (laung / lavang)
 1/2 tsp fenugreek (methi) seeds
 2 green chillies, slit
 5 curry leaves (kadi patta)
 1/4 tsp asafoetida (hing)
 1/2 tsp turmeric powder (haldi)
 1/2 tsp chilli powder
 salt to taste
 To be ground into a spice powder:
 2 cloves (laung / lavang), roasted
 1/2  " piece of cinnamon (dalchini)
 1 tsp coriander (dhania) seeds, roasted
 1 tsp cumin seeds (jeera), roasted
 1 tsp caraway seeds (shahjeera)
 2 tbsp sesame seeds (til)
 2 tbsp chopped coriander (dhania)
recipe:
Wash and soak the rice for about 10 minutes. drain and keep aside.
Combine all the ingredients including the spice powder in a pressure cooker.
Add 2½ cups of warm water and pressure cook for 2 whistles.
Allow the steam to escape before opening. separate each grain of rice lightly with fork.
Serve hot garnished with coriander.
tags:
Gujarati Khichdi 
Maharashtrian Bhaat (Rice)
Traditional Indian Rice Recipes
times: Preparation Time: 15, Cooking Time: 15, Total Time: 30 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Toothpick Khandvi recipe - How to make Toothpick Khandvi
recipe_ing:
1 cup besan (Bengal gram flour)
 1 cup  thick curds (dahi)
 1 1/2 cups water
 1/2 tsp ginger-green chilli paste
 1/4 tsp asafoetida (hing)
 1/4 tsp turmeric powder (haldi)
 salt to taste
 For vaghar:
 3 tsp oil
 1/4 tsp mustard seeds ( rai / sarson)
 1/4 tsp sesame seeds (til)
 1 tsp curry leaves (kadi patta)
 To garnish:
 2 tsp grated coconut
 2 tsp chopped coriander (dhania)
 2  pinches chilli powder
 To serve:
 40  toothpicks
recipe:
Mix all ingredients of the khandvi and strain into a non-stick kadhai only.
Put on high flame and cook for five mins.
Make sure there are no lumps formed.
When done spread the mixture on a dry granite kitchen platform or the backside of a steel thali that is greased.
Spread the mixture thinly n let dry for 30 seconds.
Roll out and cut into 2 inches pieces.
Pass each peice thru a toothpick.
Decorate on the serving dish, sprinkle chilli powder, corriander leaves, coconut.
For vaghaar
Heat oil, add mustard seeds, safed till and curry patta, when done spead over the khandvis.
Serve with green chutney.
tags:
Gujarati Farsans
Indian Snacks for Entertaining
Indian Steamed Snacks
times: Preparation Time: 2min, Cooking Time: 5min, Total Time: 7 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Suran and Raw Kela Subzi recipe - How to make Suran and Raw Kela Subzi
recipe_ing:
1/4 kg yam (suran)
 2 raw bananas
 1/4 tsp turmeric powder (haldi)
 1/2 tsp black pepper (kalimirch) powder
 1/4 tsp asafoetida (hing)
 1/2 cup grated coconut
 few curry leaves (kadi patta)
 1/4 tsp mustard seeds ( rai / sarson)
 1/2 tbsp coconut oil
 1/2 tsp soaked rice (chawal) (for   thickness)
recipe:
Cut the kela and suran into cubes and boil in water along with turmeric and salt.
Now grind the coconut,soaked rice and black pepper into paste.
Addd the above paste to the boiled vegetables and let it boil for a few minutes.
Now take a pan and pour the oil and season it with rai hing and curry leaves and
Pour over the vegetables and serve with rice.
For variation you can also boil the vegetables in a little tamarind water.
tags: Gujarati  Faral, Faraal
times: Total Time: 0 mins , Preparation Time: 15 MINUTES   Cooking Time: 25 MINUTES

recipe_long_name: Oondhiya  By Bhaviniparekh2001 recipe - How to make Oondhiya  By Bhaviniparekh2001
recipe_ing:
100 gms surti papdi (fresh vaal) , stringed
 100 gms chopped raw bananas , unpeeled
 100 gms yam (suran) cubes , peeled
 100 gms small brinjal (baingan / eggplant) , cut lengthwise
 4 to 5 green chillies , crushed
 1 tsp grated ginger (adrak)
 1/2 tsp crushed garlic (lehsun)
 1 tbsp finely chopped coriander (dhania)
 1 tbsp whole wheat flour (gehun ka atta)
 4 tbsp oil
 1/4 tsp asafoetida (hing)
 1/2 tsp turmeric powder (haldi)
 1 tsp carom seeds (ajwain)
 salt to taste
 1/2 tbsp sugar
 lemon juice to taste
 For Methi Ghatta:
 100 gms finely chopped fenugreek (methi) leaves
 1/2 cup besan (bengal gram flour)
 1 tsp chilli powder
 1 tbsp grated coconut
 salt to taste
 1 tbsp oil
recipe:
For ghatta:
Combine all the ingredients in bowl, mix well and knead into a stiff dough.
Divide the dough into small equal portions and shape them into small round cylindrical rolls.
Heat the 4 tbsp oil in a pan, add the ghattas and saute for 2 minutes.
Remove and keep aside.
How to proceed
Combine the chilli, ginger, garlic, coriander and blend in a mixer till smooth.
Transfer this paste in a bowl, add the vegetables with oil and mix well and keep aside to marinate for 30 minutes.
Heat the oil in the pan, add the vegetables, mix well and cover and cook for 4-5 minutes.
Add the papdi, turmeric, flour, ajwain and salt, mix well and cover and cook on  a slow flame till the yam is cooked.
Add the coriander, lemon, and sprinkle some water if required and add the sugar and mix well.
Serve hot with parathas.
tags:
Gujarati Shaak Sabzi
Traditional Indian Sabzis
times: Preparation Time: 30 mins, Cooking Time: 30 mins, Total Time: 1 hours,

recipe_long_name: Zatpat Papad Nu Shak recipe - How to make Zatpat Papad Nu Shak
recipe_ing:
10 papads
 3 onions
 1/2 tsp chilli powder
 1/2 tsp turmeric powder (haldi)
 1 tsp coriander (dhania) powder
 salt to taste
 oil
 cumin seeds (jeera) for tempering
recipe:
Make papad in midium pieces,and chopped onian,take kadai .
Vaghar onian with oil and jeera,fried it 2to3 minute
Add papad and saute it 2,3 minute then add  1 small glass of water and add all masala and  cooked it for 5 minute and serve it hot.
Your papad nu shak is ready to eat and quick.
tags: Gujarati Shaak Sabzi
times: Preparation Time: 5minutes, Cooking Time: 5minutes, Total Time: 10 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Oondhiu recipe - How to make Oondhiu
recipe_ing:
For The Oondhiyu:
 100 gms potatoes
 100 gms surti papdi (fresh vaal)
 100 gms green peas
 100 gms brinjal (baingan / eggplant)
 2 raw bananas , chopped
 2 sweet potatoes , peeled and chopped
 1/2 coconut , grated
 1 small purple yam (kand) , chopped
 1 tsp ginger (adrak) paste
 1 tsp green chilli paste
 1/2 tsp chilli powder
 3 tsp coriander (dhania) powder
 1/2 tsp turmeric powder (haldi)
 1/2 tsp sugar
 6 tsp oil
 1 pinch of asafoetida (hing)
 1 tsp carom seeds (ajwain) or
 1/2 tsp baking soda
 salt to taste
 For The Muthias:
 1 cup besan (bengal gram flour)
 2 cups fenugreek (methi) leaves
 1/2 tsp ginger (adrak) paste
 1/2 tsp green chilli paste
 1/4 tsp chilli powder
 1/2 tsp coriander (dhania) powder
 1/4 tsp turmeric powder (haldi)
 1 tbsp curds (dahi)
 1/2 tsp sugar
 1 tbsp oil
recipe:
For the muthias
Combine the besan along with methi leaves and masalas and curd and oil and mix well and knead into a stiff dough.
Divide the dough into small equal portions and shape them into small cylindrical rolls.
Heat the oil in a kadhai and deep fry till they turn golden brown and crisp.
Keep aside.
For the oondhiya
Heat the oil in a kadhai and add the carom seeds and asafoetida and soda bi-carbonate.
Add all the vegetables and saute for 3 minutes.
Add the masalas to the grated coconut and mix well.
Add this mixture to the vegetables, salt and prepared muthias and mix well and cook for 10 minutes.
Add some lemon juice and mix well.
Serve hot garnished with coriander.
tags:
Gujarati Shaak Sabzi
Lunch Sabzi
times: Preparation Time: 15 mins, Cooking Time: 15 mins, Total Time: 30 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Samo Kadhi recipe - How to make Samo Kadhi
recipe_ing:
1/2 cup sanwa millet (sama)
 2 cups water
 3 green chillies, finely chopped
 1/2  " piece of ginger (adrak), finely chopped
 a few curry leaves (kadi patta)
 1 tbsp chopped coriander (dhania)
 1/2 tsp cumin seeds (jeera)
 2 tbsp oil
 salt to taste
 1 cup curds (dahi)
recipe:
Wash and soak the samo in 2 cups of water
Beat the yoghurt and set aside
Heat the oil in a pan and add jeera and curry leaves
When the jeera starts spluttering put the soaked samo
Add the salt and the chopped grren chillies and ginger
The samo will be cooked in about 5/7min.
Add the beaten yoghurt and stir very well making sure the youghurt is mixed well.
Let it simmer for 2min and than add the coriander
Serve hot
tags:
Gujarati  Faral, Faraal
Kadhi recipes from all across India
times: Preparation Time: 10min, Cooking Time: 10min, Total Time: 20 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Rajgira Theplas recipe - How to make Rajgira Theplas
recipe_ing:
2 cups rajgira flour
 2  medium sized potatoes
 salt to taste
 1 1/2 tsp chilli powder
 1 tsp cumin seeds (jeera) powder
 ghee or oil for frying
 water for kneading if required
 lots of rajgira flour  for dusting
recipe:
Mash the potatoes & mix in with the rajgira flour. 
Add salt, chilli powder & jeera powder in the flour & make a firm dough.
Add water if required.
Then make lemon sized balls & roll each ball softly like a chapati. since rajgira flour doesn't have gluten, it wil stick to the rollingpin , so use lot of rajgira flour for dusting.
Heat a non stick pan, cook on both the sides.
Then add ghee or oil & cook like parathas.
Serve with potato sabzi.
tags:
Gujarati Roti, Thepla recipe collection
Gujarati  Faral, Faraal
Breakfast Theplas, Parathas
Indian Tawa
Mahashivaratri
Janmashtami
Navratri Vrat
times: Preparation Time: 20 minutes, Cooking Time: 30 minutes, Total Time: 50 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Saaboodana Khichedi recipe - How to make Saaboodana Khichedi
recipe_ing:
250 gms sago (sabudana)
 1 cup grated coconut
 5 green chillies
 50 gms peanuts
 salt to taste
 4 tbsp oil
 2 tsp sugar
 2 tsp cumin seeds (jeera)
recipe:
Method:
Soak sabudana in water for 30 min or till they are soft.
Fry (without oil) ground nuts.
Make powder of fried ground nuts.
Grind coconut and green chilies.
Mix all the ingredients except jeera and oil.
Split jeera in a pan with oil.
Put the above mixture and fry well.
Serve with yogurt (recommended), coconut chutney.
tags: Gujarati  Faral, Faraal
times: Preparation Time: 45 min, Cooking Time: 10min, Total Time: 55 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Magaj recipe - How to make Magaj
recipe_ing:
500 gms besan (bengal gram flour)
 250 gms sugar
 50 gms mava (khoya)
 10 almonds (badam) , peeled and blanched
 10 pistachios , blanched
 2 tsp cardamom (elaichi) powder
 250 gms ghee
recipe:
Method
Combine the besan with 1/2 of the ghee, mix well and sieve and keep aside.
Heat the remaining ghee in a kadhai and add the besan and saute till the besan is golden but not brown.
Add the khoya and saute for 3 minutes on a slow flame.
Meanwhile, make a sugar syrup of one thread consistency and add the syrup and cardamom powder to the fried besan and mix well.
Transfer the mixture on a gresed plate and press well using your palms.
Garnish with blanched pistas and almonds.
Cut into diamond shape pieces and allow it to cool.
Serve immediately or store in an air-tight container.
tags:
Gujarati Sweet Mithai
Traditional Indian Mithai
Quick Indian Sweets
times: Preparation Time: 20 mins, Cooking Time: 20 mins, Total Time: 40 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Rajgira Thalipeth recipe - How to make Rajgira Thalipeth
recipe_ing:
250 gms rajgira flour
 250 gms boiled potatoes
 coriander (dhania) leaves
 green chillies to taste
 curry leaves (kadi patta)
 1 tbsp cumin seeds (jeera)
 1/2 tbsp fennel seeds (saunf)
 salt to taste
 ghee for cooking
recipe:
Make a paste of corriander leaves, cumin seeds, green chillies, curry leaves and fennel.
Add the potatoes, salt and the paste to the flour and knead it into tight dough.
Add a little water if required.
Roll the dough into 1 cm thick roti ( sprinkle a little dry rejgirah flour while rolling if it is sticking to the roll palate).
Put the roti on a preheated tawa.
Make holes lightly in the roti and add ghee to these holes as well as to the side of the roti.
Roast it till golden brown on the lower side.
Turn it and repeat the procedure.
Serve it hot with farali chutney or alu sabzi.
tags:
Gujarati  Faral, Faraal
Maharashtrian Rotis / Polis
Maharashtrian Upvas (Fasting)
Mahashivaratri
Janmashtami
Navratri Vrat 
Ekadashi Recipes, Ekadasi
times: Preparation Time: 15 mins., Cooking Time: 15 mins., Total Time: 30 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Easy Besan Khandvi recipe - How to make Easy Besan Khandvi
recipe_ing:
1 1/4 cups besan (bengal gram flour)
 1 cup curds (dahi)
 2 tsp ginger-green chilli paste
 1/2 tsp turmeric powder (haldi)
 4 tbsp oil
 1 tsp mustard seeds ( rai / sarson)
 2 tbsp grated coconut
 2 tbsp chopped coriander (dhania) leaves
 1 tbsp sesame seeds (til)
 salt to taste
recipe:
Method
Grease the back of a few thalis or any smooth surface and keep aside.
Combine the besan, curds, ginger-green chilli paste, salt and turmeric powder in a deep pan and whisk well so that no lumps remain.
Cook this mixture till it thickens.
Remove from the flame and spread the batter over the greased thali as thin as possible, while the mixture is hot. Keep aside.
Cut into thin strips and gently roll into small cylindrical.
Heat the oil in a small pan and add the mustard and the sesame seeds.
When the seeds crackle, pour this to the  the khandvi.
Garnish with coriander and coconut.
Serve.
tags:
Gujarati Farsans
Indian Steamed Snacks
times: Preparation Time: 10 mins, Cooking Time: 20 mins, Total Time: 30 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Microwave Paturi recipe - How to make Microwave Paturi
recipe_ing:
1 cup besan (bengal gram flour)
 1 1/2 cups curds (dahi) mixed with 3 cups water
 2 tsp ginger-garlic (adrak-lehsun) paste
 salt to taste
 2 tsp oil
 1 tsp mustard seeds ( rai / sarson)
 dessicated coconut for garnishing
 chopped coriander (dhania) for garnishing
recipe:
Method
Combine the besan, curds, ginger-garlic paste and salt, mix well and make a smooth batter.
Transfer this in a microwave safe bowl and microwave on high for 5-6 minutes.
Spread the batter in a greased thali while its hot.
Cool and cut into 2 inch strips and roll each strip.
Put the rolls in a dish.
Put the oil in another microwave safe bowl and microwave on high for 20 seconds.
Pour this on the khandvi and garnish with dessicated coconut and coriander.
tags:
Gujarati Farsans
Jain Naashta
times: Preparation Time: 20 mins, Cooking Time: 20 mins, Total Time: 40 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Gujrati Nylon Dhokla recipe - How to make Gujrati Nylon Dhokla
recipe_ing:
1 cup besan (Bengal gram flour)
 1 1/2 tbsp semolina (rava)
 1/2 tsp citric acid (nimbu ka phool)
 3 tsp sugar
 1 tsp ginger-green chilli paste
 1 1/2 tsp  eno's fruit salt
 1 tbsp oil
 1/2 tsp mustard seeds ( rai / sarson)
 1/2 tsp sesame seeds (til)
 2 green chillies, chopped
 a pinch of asafoetida (hing)
 1 tbsp chopped coriander (dhania)
recipe:
Mix together all the ingredients for the batter except the fruit salt using enough water to make a thick batter.
Add in the fruit salt, sprinkle a little water over the fruit salt and mix well.
When the mixture rises, pour it into a greased thali and steam for about 10 minutes.
for the tempering
Heat the oil in a small katori and add the mustard seeds, sesame seeeds, green chillies and asafoetida.
When the mustard seeds crackle, add 1 tablespoon of water and pour this over the steamed dhoklas.
Cut into pieces and serve with green chutney.
tags:
Gujarati Farsans
Quick breakfast
Jain Breakfast
Breakfast Dhokla
Indian Steamed Snacks
Steam
Steamer
times: Preparation Time: 5 min, Cooking Time: 10 min, Total Time: 15 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Tomato&sev Nu Saak recipe - How to make Tomato&sev Nu Saak
recipe_ing:
8 tomatoes
 1 tsp cumin seeds (jeera)
 a few curry leaves (kadi patta)
 1/4 tsp asafoetida (hing)
 2 tbsp oil
 1 tsp chilli powder
 1/2 tsp turmeric powder (haldi)
 1 tsp coriander-cumin seeds (dhania-jeera) powder
 1 tbsp jaggery (gur) or 3 tsp sugar
 2 green chillies and 1" piece ginger (adrak) paste
 salt to taste
 2 tbsp chopped coriander (dhania)
 3/4 cup  thin savoury sev (made from gram flour)
recipe:
Wash and put tomatoes into a pan of boiling water.
Leave for 2 min .
Drain the water.
Peel off the skin from the tomatoes and chopthem into small pieces.
Heat 2 tbls of oil in a saucepan. add the curry leaves whole jeera and asofoetida.
When the jeera starts crackling put the chopped tomatoes and stir.
Add all the spices and the chilli ginger paste and jaggery.
Let it cook on a medium heat stiring ocaasionally to prevent sticking at the bottom for 10min.
Add the chopped coriander(leaving a few for decoration) and savoury sev just before serving.
tags: Gujarati Shaak Sabzi
times: Preparation Time: 5, Cooking Time: 10min, Total Time: 15 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Chola Methi Dhoklas recipe - How to make Chola Methi Dhoklas
recipe_ing:
1 cup chola dal (split cow peas)
 1 1/2 cups chopped fenugreek (methi) leaves
 5 chopped green chillies
 1/4 tsp asafoetida (hing)
 2 tbsp curd (dahi)
 1 tsp baking powder
 2 tsp oil
 2 pinches baking soda
recipe:
Method
Soak the dal for 4 hours.
Drain and blend in a mixer along with green chillies, adding a little water.
Add the asafoetida and salt and mix well.
Add the curds and baking powder and mix well.
Add the oil, mix well and cover and keep aside for 2 to 3 hours.
Sprinkle the soda bi-carb and salt over the fenugreek leaves.
Grease the idli moulds and put a few fenugreek leaves in each ring.
Pour a spoonful of batterin each mould and steam for 5 to 7 minutes.
Serve hot with green chutney.
tags:
Gujarati Farsans
Low Cal Breakfast
Breakfast Dhokla
times: Preparation Time: 20 mins, Cooking Time: 15 mins, Total Time: 35 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Dhokla ( Chola Methi) recipe - How to make Dhokla ( Chola Methi)
recipe_ing:
1 cup chola dal (split cow peas)
 1 1/2 cups chopped fenugreek (methi) leaves
 5 crushed green chillies
 1/4 tsp asafoetida (hing)
 2 tbsp curds (dahi)
 1 tsp baking powder
 2 pinches soda bi-carb
 2 tsp oil
recipe:
Method
Soak the dal in enough water for 4 hours.
Drain and blend in a mixer along with green chillies, using a little water.
Add the asafoetida and salt and mix well.
Add the curds and baking powder and whisk well.
Add the oil, mix well and cover and keep aside for 2 to 3 hours.
Sprinkle the soda bi-carb and salt over the fenugreek leaves.
Grease the idli moulds with oil and sprinkle a few fenugreek leaves in each mould.
Pour a spoonful of batter in each mould and steam in an idli steamer for 15-20 minutes.
Serve hot with green chutney.
tags:
Gujarati Farsans
Low Cal Breakfast
Breakfast Dhokla
times: Preparation Time: 20 mins, Cooking Time: 20 mins, Total Time: 40 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Cocktail Cheela recipe - How to make Cocktail Cheela
recipe_ing:
2 cups besan (bengal gram flour)
 1/2 cup finely chopped onions
 1 chopped tomato
 1 chopped green chillies
 2 tsp chopped coriander (dhania)
 1 tsp garam masala
 salt to taste
 1/2 tsp chilli powder
 2 tbsp oil
recipe:
Method
Comine all ingredients in a bowl, mix well and add 2 cups of water gradually to make a smooth batter of flowing consistency.
Heat a non stick pan and pour a spoonful of batter and spread evenly to make small round pancakes.
Flip over when one side is cooked, using a little oil.
Serve ot hwith mint chutney and tomato sauce.
tags:
Gujarati Farsans
Breakfast  Chillas, Indian Pancakes
Indian Pancakes
times: Preparation Time: 10 mins, Cooking Time: 10 mins, Total Time: 20 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Healthy Low Cal Khandvi recipe - How to make Healthy Low Cal Khandvi
recipe_ing:
1/4 cup besan (bengal gram flour)
 1 cup low fat curds (dahi)
 2 tsp ginger-green chilli paste
 1/2 tsp turmeric powder (haldi)
 For The Tempering:
 3 to 4 whole dry kashmiri red chillies
 1 tsp mustard seeds ( rai / sarson)
 1 tsp sesame seeds (til)
 1/2 tsp asafoetida (hing)
 4 tbsp oil
 salt to taste
 For Garnishing:
 2 tbsp grated coconut
 2 tbsp chopped coriander (dhania)
recipe:
Method
Grease the back of a few thalis or any smooth surface and keep aside.
Combine the besan, ginger- green chilli paste, salt and turmeric powder and mix well.
Add the curds and whisk well so as no lumps remain.
Transfer in a non-stick pan and cook this mixture for a few minutes until all the water has been absorbed and a soft dough like consistency has been obtained.
Spread the mixture on the greased thali as thin as possible.
Cool and cut them into wide strips of about 1" or 2" thick and roll them like swiss rolls. Keep aside.
For the tempering, heat the oil in a small pan and add the mustard and sesame seeds.
When the seeds crackle, add the remaining ingredients and saute for 10 seconds.
Pour onto the khandvi and garnish with coriander and coconut. Serve hot.
tags:
Gujarati Farsans
Jain Naashta
times: Preparation Time: 10 mins, Cooking Time: 10 mins, Total Time: 20 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Khandvi Sandwich! recipe - How to make Khandvi Sandwich!
recipe_ing:
For The Khandvi:
 2 tbsp soya flour
 2 tbsp besan (bengal gram flour)
 1 cup buttermilk
 1/4 tsp chilli powder
 salt to taste
 For Sandwiches:
 6 slices of brown bread
 1 onion , thinly sliced
 1/2 cup cabbage , thinly shredded.
 2 lettuce , thinly shredded
 1 carrot , grated
 2 tbsp grated processed cheese
 1 tbsp green chutney
 1 tbsp butter
recipe:
For the khandvi
Combine all the ingredients in a deep pan and whisk well so that no lumps remain.
Cook on a slow flame, while stirring continuously or till the mixture becomes thick.
Pour this hot mixture on a clean greased surface and spread evenly while the mixture is still hot.
Cool completely and cut the spread into squares, same size bread slices.
Keep aside.
How to proceed
Butter each slice on one side and place 3 buttered sides up on counter top.
Apply chutney to three slices and place chutney side up counter top.
Place a khandvi square on each chutney slice and arrange a few onions slices over khandvi.
Sprinkle some carrot, and cheese over onions and sprinkle a little salt.
Top with buttered slice, butter side down and press each sandwich very gently, and cut into triangles.
Sprinkle some cabbage on a serving plate and arrange sandwiches in serving plate, piling if desired.
Garnish with chopped salad leaves.
Cover with moist cloth and refrigerate till required.
